comments.html: I believe it's a way to entice customers to migrate away from DWDM platforms currently running MEF style EVP-LAN instance which preserves VLAN headers but doesn't isolate broadcast domain per VLAN. Come to our packet based platform and we can give you the same thing plus proper VLAN isolation.
comments.name: Jeff Behrns

comments.html: Number of MAC-VRF EVPN instances is limited (platform/os limitations). Serving multiple BDs/VLANs by one MAC-VRF could be a solution.
comments.name: Radu Pavaloiu

comments.html: We're using this mode of operation because we decouple VLAN allocation (to an extent) from VXLAN administration and we do not have our Arista configs controlled by an automation solution. We absolutely do not want anyone having to revisit every router in the network just to add a new VLAN. Also, we have around a thousand VLANs being transported - the size & complexity of the config, esp. given that it's still managed by humans, is in fact a major concern.
comments.name: Adam Thompson
